definitions.definition: Cunning, sometimes manifested as trickery.
The art of using deceptive speech or writing.
An argument that seems plausible, but is fallacious or misleading, especially one devised deliberately to be so.
A stopped consonant; a stop.
An actor who does not speak; a mime performer.
A person who does not have the power of speech.
A hired mourner at a funeral; an undertaker's assistant.
An object for dulling the sound of an instrument, especially a brass instrument, or damper for pianoforte; a sordine.
An electronic switch or control that mutes the sound.
A mute swan.
To silence, to make quiet.
To turn off the sound of.
definitions.example: Please mute the music while I make a call.

definitions.definition: Not having the power of speech; dumb.
Silent; not making a sound.
Not uttered; unpronounced; silent; also, produced by complete closure of the mouth organs which interrupt the passage of breath; said of certain letters.
Not giving a ringing sound when struck; said of a metal.
The faeces of a hawk or falcon.
Of a bird: to defecate.
To cast off; to moult.
A species of freshwater game fish, Tinca tinca.
To build as, or cover with a vault.
To jump or leap over.
definitions.example: The fugitive vaulted over the fence to escape.

definitions.definition: The practice of constructing vaults, or a particular method of such construction.
A vaulted structure; such structures treated as a group.
The sport of gymnastics and dance routines performed on horseback, and on the longe line.
Leaning upward or over
Exaggerated or overreaching
Performing
Extreme pain.
The sufferings of Jesus Christ in the garden of Gethsemane.
Violent contest or striving.
Paroxysm of joy; keen emotion.
The last struggle of life; death struggle.
A sample driving session in a motor vehicle, in order to assess its quality before purchase.
Any preliminary assessment of something through use.
To take a motor vehicle on the road to assess its quality before purchase.
To make a preliminary assessment of something through its use.
A line of motor vehicles causing or the result of traffic congestion or a traffic jam; backup.
A running back or halfback who lines up furthest to the rear in an I formation.
A person who bakes and sells bread, cakes and similar items.
A portable oven for baking.
Not spoken or expressed.
definitions.example: I could guess her unvoiced opinon.

definitions.definition: Spoken without vibration of the vocal chords.
(of a signal) That does not contain voice.
Of an IRC user: not granted voice privileges.
A building that trades stocks in of companies for money and vice versa.
An organisation that trades stocks in of companies for money and vice versa.
A verdict upon an inquest which finds that a crime has been committed without specifying the criminal.

(other ballgames) a kick in which a player may kick the ball without interference from the opposition. Such a kick may be awarded for a foul by the opposition, or earned by a player such as by taking a mark.
The usual means of restarting play after a foul is committed, where the non-offending team restarts from where the foul was committed.
A glass tube, rounded at one end and open at the other; used for small-scale laboratory tests
Produced in a test tube
Conceived or developed in vitro by artificial insemination
To throw into a state of disorder.
To knock out of order or sequence.
Chaotic; without clear order; in a state of disorder.
Deranged.

A musical instrument in the brass family, having a cylindrical bore, and usually a sliding tube (but sometimes piston valves, and rarely both). Most often refers to the tenor trombone, which is the most common type of trombone and has a fundamental tone of B♭ˌ (contra B♭).
definitions.example: Jim plays the trombone very well.

definitions.definition: The common European bittern.
To transmit a signal or data back to a central switching point before sending it out to its destination.
To extend and retract (the zoom lens); to use it too enthusiastically.
A chief lighting technician for a motion-picture or television production.
A glassblower.
An old man.
A foreman.
A sailor.
(in Maritime regions) The baby in the house.
A person who sells flowers.
A person who cultivates flowers.
A person who studies or writes about flowers.
A florist's shop.
To disembark from an airplane.
Without a driver.
definitions.example: a driverless vehicle

definitions.definition: A class of people in a society characterized by low incomes, low level of education, high unemployment and, as a result of these, a low social status.
Obscured by mist or fog; unclear; hazy
Confused, befuddled, etc.
definitions.example: He was still foggy with sleep.

definitions.definition: One who designs and executes marketing campaigns.
One who sells goods at a market.
To make something unstable.
To become unstable.
A text or photographic image that has been reduced in size to that of a typographical dot in order to escape detection by unintended recipients.
A small-sized tablet containing lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD).
To make a microdot of.
The place where the optic nerve attaches to the retina, and so where the retina cannot detect light.
In driving, the part of the road that cannot be seen in the rear-view mirror.
definitions.example: When he changed lanes, he sideswiped a car that was in his blind spot.

definitions.definition: In a stadium or auditorium, any location affording those seated or standing there only an obstructed visual or auditory experience.
definitions.example: Our seats turned out to be in a blind spot behind a pillar blocking our view on the stage.

definitions.definition: An inability to recognize a fact or think clearly about a certain topic, especially because of a prejudice.
definitions.example: He loves her so much that he has a blind spot when it comes to her faults.

definitions.definition: A subject or area about which one is uninformed or misinformed, often because of a prejudice or lack of appreciation.
definitions.example: The new study addresses the blind spot created by previous research having excluded healthy adult subjects.

definitions.definition: A location where radio reception and/or transmission is significantly poorer than in surrounding locations.
A pontoon; a narrow shallow boat propelled by a pole.
To propel a punt or similar craft by means of a pole.
A kick made by a player who drops the ball and kicks it before it hits the ground.
To dropkick; to kick something a considerable distance.
To equivocate and delay or put off (answering a question, addressing an issue, etc).
To retreat from one's objective; to abandon an effort one still notionally supports.
To make the best choice from a set of non-ideal alternatives.
A point in the game of faro.
The act of playing at basset, baccara, faro, etc.
A bet or wager.
Gambling, as a pastime, especially betting on horseraces or the dogs.
A highly speculative investment or other commitment.
A wild guess.
An indentation in the base of a wine bottle.
A thin glass rod which is temporarily attached to a larger piece in order to better manipulate the larger piece.
To play at basset, baccara, faro, etc.
To stake against the bank, to back a horse, to gamble or take a chance more generally
To make a highly speculative investment or other commitment, or take a wild guess.
The Irish pound, used as the unit of currency of Ireland until it was replaced by the euro in 2002.
To deprive of inhabitants.
To devastate or lay waste somewhere.
To abandon or forsake something.
To make someone sad, forlorn and hopeless.
Deserted and devoid of inhabitants.
definitions.example: a desolate isle; a desolate wilderness; a desolate house

definitions.definition: Barren and lifeless.
Made unfit for habitation or use because of neglect, destruction etc.
definitions.example: desolate altars

definitions.definition: Dismal or dreary.
Sad, forlorn and hopeless.
definitions.example: He was left desolate by the early death of his wife.

definitions.definition: A twin-hulled ship or boat.
A quarrelsome woman; a scold.
A raft of three pieces of wood lashed together, the middle piece being longer than the others, and serving as a keel on which the rower squats while paddling.
An old kind of fireship.

A road that is raised, so as to be above water, marshland, and similar low-lying obstacles. Originally causeways were much like dykes, generally pierced to let water through, whereas many modern causeways are more like bridges or viaducts.
To pave, to cobble.
A small house near a main house, for lodging visitors.
A private house offering accommodation to paying guests; a boarding house; a bed and breakfast.
(chiefly in plural) Any solid or liquid in a subdivided state, especially one that exhibits special characteristics which are negligible in the bulk material.
definitions.example: Particulates in engine oil can abrade moving parts.

definitions.definition: Composed of separate particles.
definitions.example: particulate air pollution

definitions.definition: Pertaining to heritable characteristics which are attributable discretely to either one or another of an offspring's parents, rather than a blend of the two.
The reproductive cell or gamete of the male; a spermatozoon.
Semen; the generative substance of male animals.
Sperm oil; whale oil from a sperm whale; spermaceti.
To ejaculate.
To ejaculate on or into.
A simulation or simulator.
definitions.example: They played a flight sim all afternoon.

definitions.definition: A long zirconium tube, filled with pellets of uranium oxide, stacked in bundles inside a nuclear reactor as fuel.
A shop which sells used goods (especially clothes) at low prices.
A domestic pigeon which transports attached messages or very small parcels from the place where it is released to a familiar destination.
The plant Glycyrrhiza glabra, or sometimes in North America the related American Licorice plant Glycyrrhiza lepidota.
A type of candy made from that plant's dried root or its extract.
A black colour, named after the licorice.
A flavouring agent made from dried root portions of the aforementioned plant.
To suspend (a parliamentary session) or to discontinue the meetings of (an assembly, parliament etc.) without formally ending the session.
To defer.
To prolong or extend.
A light shoe having an upper made of fabric and a sole of rope.
Relating to the use of science and technology in the investigation and establishment of facts or evidence in a court of law.
Relating to, or appropriate for, courts of law.
Relating to, or used in, debate or argument.
To put (something) down, to rest.
definitions.example: Set the tray there.

definitions.definition: To attach or affix (something) to something else, or in or upon a certain place.
definitions.example: I have set my heart on running the marathon.

definitions.definition: To put in a specified condition or state; to cause to be.
To start (a fire).
To cause to stop or stick; to obstruct; to fasten to a spot.
definitions.example: to set a coach in the mud

definitions.definition: To determine or settle.
definitions.example: to set the rent

definitions.definition: To adjust.
definitions.example: I set the alarm at 6 a.m.

definitions.definition: To punch (a nail) into wood so that its head is below the surface.
To arrange with dishes and cutlery, to set the table.
definitions.example: Please set the table for our guests.

definitions.definition: To introduce or describe.
definitions.example: I’ll tell you what happened, but first let me set the scene.

definitions.definition: To locate (a play, etc.); to assign a backdrop to, geographically or temporally.
definitions.example: He says he will set his next film in France.

definitions.definition: To compile, to make (a puzzle or challenge).
definitions.example: This crossword was set by Araucaria.

definitions.definition: To prepare (a stage or film set).
To fit (someone) up in a situation.
To arrange (type).
definitions.example: It was a complex page, but he set it quickly.

definitions.definition: To devise and assign (work) to.
definitions.example: The teacher set her students the task of drawing a foot.

definitions.definition: To direct (the ball) to a teammate for an attack.
To solidify.
definitions.example: The glue sets in four minutes.

definitions.definition: To render stiff or solid; especially, to convert into curd; to curdle.
definitions.example: to set milk for cheese

definitions.definition: Of a heavenly body, to disappear below the horizon of a planet, etc, as the latter rotates.
definitions.example: The moon sets at eight o'clock tonight.

definitions.definition: To defeat a contract.
(now followed by "out", as in set out) To begin to move; to go forth.
To produce after pollination.
definitions.example: to set seed

definitions.definition: (of fruit) To be fixed for growth; to strike root; to begin to germinate or form.
(Midwestern US) To sit (be in a seated position).
definitions.example: He sets in that chair all day.

definitions.definition: To hunt game with the aid of a setter.
Of a dog, to indicate the position of game.
definitions.example: The dog sets the bird.

definitions.definition: To apply oneself; to undertake earnestly.
To fit music to words.
To place plants or shoots in the ground; to plant.
definitions.example: to set pear trees in an orchard

definitions.definition: To become fixed or rigid; to be fastened.
To have a certain direction of motion; to flow; to move on; to tend.
definitions.example: The current sets to the north; the tide sets to the windward.

definitions.definition: (country dancing) To acknowledge a dancing partner by facing him or her and moving first to one side and then to the other, while she or he does the opposite.
definitions.example: Set to partners! was the next instruction from the caller.

definitions.definition: To place or fix in a setting.
definitions.example: to set a precious stone in a border of metal

definitions.definition: To put in order in a particular manner; to prepare.
definitions.example: to set (that is, to hone) a razor

definitions.definition: To extend and bring into position; to spread.
definitions.example: to set the sails of a ship

definitions.definition: To give a pitch to, as a tune; to start by fixing the keynote.
definitions.example: to set a psalm

definitions.definition: To reduce from a dislocated or fractured state.
definitions.example: to set a broken bone

definitions.definition: To lower into place and fix solidly, as the blocks of cut stone in a structure.
To wager in gambling; to risk.
To adorn with something infixed or affixed; to stud; to variegate with objects placed here and there.
To value; to rate; used with at.
To establish as a rule; to furnish; to prescribe; to assign.
definitions.example: to set a good example

definitions.definition: To suit; to become.
definitions.example: It sets him ill.

definitions.definition: To divide a class group in a subject according to ability
The system of tunnels that is the home of a badger.
The pattern of distinctive threads and yarns that make up the plaid of a Scottish tartan.
A small, square-cut piece of quarried stone used for paving and edging.
A schoolchild, a kid who attends school; a schoolboy or schoolgirl.
A soft, legless larva of a fly or other dipterous insect, that often eats decomposing organic matter.
A worthless person.
definitions.example: Drop and give me fifty, maggot.

definitions.definition: A whimsy or fancy.
A fan of the American metal band Slipknot.
Any of various large seabirds of the family Diomedeidae ranging widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific and having a hooked beak and long narrow wings.
Any of various African and Asian pierid butterflies of the genus Appias. Some species of this genus are also known as puffins.
A double eagle, or three under par on any one hole, except a par 3 hole.
A long-term impediment, burden, or curse.

A property transaction where a party sells something, then leases it from the purchaser. The seller is released from tax, depreciation, and maintenance costs, and the buyer is guaranteed an income from the property.https//web.archive.org/web/20070827183530/http://www.bartleby.com/61/15/L0091500.html
To morally corrupt (someone); to seduce.
To debase (something); to lower the value of (something).
To indulge in revelry.
Indulging in or characterised by sensual pleasures to a degree perceived to be morally harmful; corrupted; immoral; self-indulgent.
To give one's time, focus one's efforts, commit oneself, etc. entirely for, on, or to a certain matter
definitions.example: I devoted this afternoon to repainting my study, and nothing will get in my way.

definitions.definition: To consign over; to doom
definitions.example: The city was devoted to the flames.

definitions.definition: To execrate; to curse
Vowed; dedicated; consecrated.
Strongly emotionally attached; very fond of someone or something.
definitions.example: Bob and Sara are devoted to their children.

definitions.definition: Zealous; characterized by devotion.
Cursed; doomed.
A public official who presides over an inquest into unnatural deaths, cases of treasure trove, and debris from shipwrecks.
A medical doctor who performs autopsies and determines time and cause of death from a scientific standpoint.
The administrative head of a sheading.
(of a person, thing, situation, etc.) Causing irritation, annoyance, or discomfort; bothersome, irksome.
definitions.example: My poison ivy rash is very nettlesome.

definitions.definition: (of a task, problem, etc.) Thorny; difficult to deal with, especially due to being complex or tricky.
definitions.example: Be careful what you say to him; he's a nettlesome fellow.

definitions.definition: The act of agitating, or the state of being agitated; the state of being moved with violence, or with irregular action; commotion.
definitions.example: After a storm the sea is in agitation.

definitions.definition: A stirring up or arousing; disturbance of tranquillity; disturbance of mind which shows itself by physical excitement; perturbation.
definitions.example: She causes great agitation within me.

definitions.definition: Excitement of public feeling by discussion, appeals, etc.
definitions.example: After this conflict pro-independence agitation temporarily died down.

definitions.definition: Examination or consideration of a subject in controversy, or of a plan proposed for adoption; earnest discussion; debate.
Very fine solid particles (smoke, dust) or liquid droplets (moisture) suspended in the air, slightly limiting visibility.
A reduction of transparency of a clear gas or liquid.
An analogous dullness on a surface that is ideally highly reflective or transparent.
definitions.example: The furniture has a haze, possibly from some kind of wax.

definitions.definition: Any state suggestive of haze in the atmosphere, such as mental confusion or vagueness of memory.
(packaging) The degree of cloudiness or turbidity in a clear glass or plastic, measured in percent.
Any substance causing turbidity in beer or wine.
To be or become hazy, or thick with haze.
To perform an unpleasant initiation ritual upon a usually non-consenting individual, especially freshmen to a closed community such as a college or military unit.
To oppress or harass by forcing to do hard and unnecessary work.
In a rodeo, to assist the bulldogger by keeping (the steer) running in a straight line.
A wheeled vehicle with a drivetrain that allows all wheels to receive torque from the engine simultaneously, particularly where power is directed to the wheels with the best contact with the ground.
To guide the course of a vessel, vehicle, aircraft etc. (by means of a device such as a rudder, paddle, or steering wheel).
definitions.example: I steered homeward.

definitions.definition: To guide the course of a vessel, vehicle, aircraft etc. (by means of a device such as a rudder, paddle, or steering wheel).
definitions.example: I find it very difficult to steer a skateboard.

definitions.definition: To be directed and governed; to take a direction, or course; to obey the helm.
definitions.example: The boat steers easily.

definitions.definition: To direct a group of animals.
To maneuver or manipulate a person or group into a place or course of action.
definitions.example: Hume believes that principles of association steer the imagination of artists.

definitions.definition: To direct a conversation.
To conduct oneself; to take or pursue a course of action.
To castrate (a male calf).
Equipment used to control direction; something used to steer.
definitions.example: I hit a rock with my car and broke the steering.

definitions.definition: A small wading bird, Calidris alpina, found along the coast and having a distinctive black belly patch in its breeding plumage. A type of stint.
A long board, often covered with fabric and having on legs that are usually collapsible, on which one can iron clothes.
A flat-chested woman.
An ascetic or practitioner of yoga (yogi) who has given up pursuit of the first three Hindu goals of life: kama (enjoyment), artha (practical objectives) and even dharma (duty).
To make a phone call to (this place).
definitions.example: John has just rung in sick. He won't be back til Monday, he says.

definitions.definition: To celebrate by ringing of bells or as if by ringing of the bells.
definitions.example: We will ring in the New Year at a ski resort.

definitions.definition: To encircle, to surround in a ring, engirdle.
A school that teaches its pupils the grammar system of a European language, especially Latin and Greek.
A secondary school that stresses academic over practical or vocational education, until recent times open to those pupils who had passed the 11-plus examination.
Elementary school.
The multiplication or natural increase in a population
The dissemination of something to a larger area or greater number
The act of propagating, especially the movement of a wave
The elongation part of transcription
Winning new converts
Some degree of success in the spread of propaganda
The slaying of a human being.
The unlawful killing of a human, either in negligence or incidentally to the commission of some unlawful act, but without specific malice, or upon a sudden excitement of anger.
A statement or an idea which is unproven, but is thought to be true; a guess.
definitions.example: I explained it, but it is pure conjecture whether he understood, or not.

definitions.definition: A supposition based upon incomplete evidence; a hypothesis.
definitions.example: The physicist used his conjecture about subatomic particles to design an experiment.

definitions.definition: (philology) A statement likely to be true based on available evidence, but which has not been formally proven.
Interpretation of signs and omens.
To guess; to venture an unproven idea.
definitions.example: I do not know if it is true; I am simply conjecturing here.

definitions.definition: To infer on slight evidence; to guess at.
To have a negative impact on (someone's position, chances etc.).
To cause prejudice in; to bias the mind of.
Having prejudices.
A cultivar of chicory (Cichorium intybus var. foliosum) with red leaves and a slightly bitter taste, eaten as a salad vegetable
The edge of a geological stratum at the surface of the ground; the outcrop.
A basset hound.
A card game resembling faro.
To incline upward so as to appear at the surface.
definitions.example: A vein of coal bassets.

definitions.definition: That serves to demonstrate, show or prove
Given to open displays of emotion
(grammar) that specifies the thing or person referred to
A small bone (or bony structure), especially one of the three of the middle ear.
definitions.example: The incus is one of the three auditory ossicles.

definitions.definition: Bone-like joint or plate, especially:
One of the four (one upper and one lower on each side) rearmost molars in humans, which typically develop between ages 18-24.
A room, or section, or chamber
definitions.example: Two men were seated in a well-lighted compartment of a third-class railway carriage.

definitions.definition: One of the parts into which an area is subdivided.
Part of a protein that serves a specific function.
A mound (often of grass) beneath the shield in a coat of arms on which the supporters stand.
A region in the body, delimited by a biological membrane.
To arrange in separate compartments.
(sometimes hyphenated, especially when used attributively) Something which sickens, causes distress, or appalls by reason of being disgusting, gory, or repulsive.
definitions.example: 2014 April 19, Stephen Schaefer, "http//bostonherald.com/entertainment/movies/movie_reviews/2014/04/wayans_haunted_sequel_fails_to_scare_up_laughs Wayans’ ‘Haunted’ sequel fails

definitions.definition: A small enclosure housing a public telephone

(travel) A callsign assigned to a commercial flight for the purposes of reservation and ticketing, typically consisting of a 2 character airline code and a 1 to 4 digit number to indicate a particular service.
Sound with a frequency greater than the upper limit of human hearing, which is approximately 20 kilohertz.
The use of ultrasonic waves for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.
To treat with ultrasound.
The combining of the nuclei of small atoms to form the nuclei of larger ones, with a resulting release of large quantities of energy; the process that makes the sun shine, and hydrogen bomb explode.
An act of endearment; any act or expression of affection; an embracing, or touching, with tenderness.
A gentle stroking or rubbing.
To touch or kiss lovingly; to fondle.
definitions.example: She loves being caressed by her boyfriend.

definitions.definition: To affect as if with a caress.
To overload a circuit to the point that the fuse (or circuit breaker) protecting it triggers, opening the circuit.
To lose one's temper; to become enraged.
definitions.example: When he learned that his daughter had eloped, he blew a fuse.

definitions.definition: An earthquake.

An automobile driving manoeuvre where the driver starts turning the vehicle and then pulls on the handbrake to make the rear tyres lose adhesion and thus cause the back of the vehicle to slide around (in the direction of the turn).
An abrupt change of opinion.
(games) A game in which two players take turns putting circles and crosses on a 3x3 grid and try to get three of the same symbols in a line
A young tree, but bigger than a seedling.
A youngster, especially a male nearing maturity.
A long-tailed American songbird of the Mimidae family, noted for its ability to mimic calls of other birds.
